Unusual modifications to Windows Registr.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4657 for modifications to sensitive or commonly abused Registry keys (e.g., Run keys, BITS jobs). Analyze changes for signs of obfuscated or encoded data. Use frequency analysis on modified keys to identify outliers.

Suspicious activity involving the WMI re.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 5861 for new WMI provider registrations. Investigate the associated executable and command line. Correlate WMI activity with unusual process creation events (e.g., Windows Event ID 4688) or network connections (Zeek conn.log) that occur shortly after the WMI event. Use time series analysis to detect unusual spikes in WMI activity.
